answers.answer: Whats the risk? As far as I know, the more liquid u have the better. Have they explained it to u?

Es...it's mostly common for causing still born deaths and other complications like diabetes...blood sugar and mental retardation.  And it's not better to have a lot of fluid. I thought the same thing but I had drove 5 hours just to hear bad news. :( the doctor told me that the baby has to have elevated levels of fluid around them, not to much and not to little. There are risk factors for both. And unfortunately I have a massive amount of fluid around my little man. I can only pray that he can be safe throughout this.
Praying for you and your baby! Have faith everything is going to be just fine. :)
Praying for you and your baby! Dont worry, everything will turn out fine. Please, keep us posted.
Awwwww I'm sorry to hear this. I'll keep you in my prayers try and relax which I know it's Easier said then done.

question: So I'm probably going to have to be induced at 39 weeks if my water don't break on its own before then because the imneotic sack is to big and it could cause risk.. I am almost 37 weeks. I'm pretty nervous about the risk they told me so please pray for me and my baby boy.  Thanks ♥                love my family mommy of 3. ♡
title: to much fluid around the baby.
